definition: to audit accounts/to inspect accounting books
to research/to check/to investigate/to examine/to refer to/to look up (e.g. a word in a dictionary)

sentences.english: Not to mention the fact that Chinese companies are unaudited and misleading on their assets.
sentences.chinese: 更别提中国企业没有查帐和误导资产价值。

sentences.english: The specific content and procedure of auditing accounts are detailed in Appendix 4 to the Contract.
sentences.chinese: 具体的查帐内容和程序详见本合同附件四。

sentences.english: The auditor looked through all the vouchers.
sentences.chinese: 查帐员审核了全部凭单。

definition: to verify accounting records/also written 對賬|对账[dui4 zhang4]
render an account/submit an expense account/apply for reimbursement
to verify accounting records/also written 對帳|对帐[dui4 zhang4]
an accounts office (in former times)/an accountant/a cashier
money farm (dealing in illegal foreign currency of money laundering)
to write off/to cancel an account/to draw a line under
